result.execSummary:
The defendant Aleesha A Garcia Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 60 days; alternate 5 days jail.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Aleesha A Garcia Rodriguez in court with attorney Patrick J. Schott.  Edward M Bremberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Prosecuting attorney moves to amend Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:  $267.50 to be paid within 60 days or 5 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine. Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
dated 7/11/16 filed by Attorney Schott requesting plea hearing.
